item.title: Ticket #480 (static pages are assigned a author ID of 0 when editing) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When saving a static page WP assumes that $_POSTpost_author? is set to use for the authorID of pages this is only true for blog posts btu not for static pages.

item.title: Ticket #479 (problems with non ascii chars in 1.3) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: I'm using pretty current software on my developing workstation PHP 5.0.2 and MySQL 4.1.7 and apache 2.0.52 and was having big difficulties entering non ascii chars into post and pages. Basically the post would get cut off at the non ascii char. The thing that got me was that phpMyAdmin was working fine. After much searching and frustration. I found out that the browser was delivering the wp content in non utf-8 where as the it was delivering the phpmyadmin content in utf-8.

item.title: Changeset [1872]: Allow empty uris to be passed to add_query_arg(). Useful when ...
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Allow empty uris to be passed to add_query_arg(). Useful when appending arguments to WP_Query query strings that do not yet have any arguments.

item.title: Ticket #478 (import-rss: support for timezone of original post (code inside)) created
item.dc:creator: dsandler
item.description: Feature request: honor TZ in <dc:date> when importing from RSS Implementation: massage the ISO 8601:2000 date format into something strtotime() will understand Patch: attached [import-rss-tz.patch] Caveat: It Works For Me(TM) but lightly tested. Hopefully this will give someone a head-start on implementing the feature.

item.title: Ticket #477 (import-rss: <dc:date> ignored even if no <pubdate>) created
item.dc:creator: dsandler
item.description:
import-rss.php: 92 | preg_match('|<pubdate>(.*?)</pubdate>|is', $post, $date); 93 | $date = strtotime($date[1]); 94 | 95 | if (!$date) :

The test on line 95 will never be true, even if no <pubdate> tag was found, because strtotime will return -1 when called with an empty string.

This bug will cause import-rss.php to be almost entirely useless for RSS 1.0 feeds which use only the Dublin Core date tag and not the Dave Winer date tag.

item.title: Ticket #475 (post slug problem) created
